intro: Boechera demissa var. languida, commonly known as the slender rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. This perennial species typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine regions. Its compact growth habit and ability to thrive in harsh environments make it an adaptable and resilient plant. The plant's botanical features reflect its adaptation to cold, arid climates and nutrient-poor substrates.
